summary: Listen to music, radio & podcasts in 1 app. Audio content for any genre

scraped_reviews.content: I mentioned in a review earlier this year that they've been periodically removing albums on this app which makes it impossible to access tracks from them anymore, but I just recently checked certain Artist Playlists and discovered that not only are there more missing albums, but albums whose tracks are all missing! I don't know why all this is happening but it's clear to me that things haven't gotten any better. I think it might be time to try another music streaming app for a change.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Jeremy, Ee're sorry to hear about your less than ideal listening experience. Would you be able to reach out to and provide us with additional info on your experience? Send an email to android@iheartradio.com.

scraped_reviews.content: Stops playback when you put your phone to sleep, under the guise of "buffering" and as soon as you unlock your phone to try to restart the app, it starts playing again. update: this app still sucks. it will play ads more than music/radio. suddenly stops playing when listening to radio, but has no problem playing ads. and more ads. and more ads. and more ads. 0/10 would recommend. update: it keeps getting worse. plays ads just fine, doesn't play radio.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Dylan, we're sorry to hear about your less than ideal listening experience. Would you be able to reach out to and provide us with additional info on your experience? Send an email to android@iheartradio.com (mailto:android@iheartradio.com). We want to keep you as a listener!

scraped_reviews.content: This is the only music service that's good as the free version but I have a suggestions: 1 Put the full name of a song (album name, version, remaster, etc.) when searching for new songs 2 Let free users look at recently played songs (even if we can't play them 3 Sometimes the music just stops completely and I have to restart my play list. Normally that'd be fine but it happens too often not to be an annoyance, so fix that please. otherwise, great service
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, thanks for taking the time to leave us feedback about your experience using iHeartRadio! We love hearing from our listeners about how we're doing! If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to reach out to android@iheartradio.com.

scraped_reviews.content: Ever since the hurricanes came through Florida, there is a glitch in the system. Whenever there is a power switch, like tower to tower, or wifi on to off, about a minute of Iheart (not local) ads will interrupt and play. It's extremely annoying missing a minute or so of whatever I'm listening to just from going from the car to the house. Happens across different stations, so it's definitely the app. This same thing has happened before, so I know it can be fixed.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear about your less than ideal listening experience. Would you be able to reach out to and provide us with additional info on your experience? Send an email to android@iheartradio.com. We want to keep you as a listener!

scraped_reviews.content: The app is great, I do like it, with great sound quality and the ability to listen anywhere, HWVR, the introduction of ads that play multiple times a day whenever I start listening to a station again, is really excessive and unnecessary. iHeart's little banner saying ads help keep it free is a bit laughable considering we are already subjected to ads that play on the radio channel for about 51% of the time already! So in addition to that we need more ads every time we tune into a channel?? ðŸ¤¨
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Randy, thanks for taking the time to leave us feedback about your experience using iHeartRadio! Please feel free to send an email to android@iheartradio.com if you have any  questions or concerns. We'll be happy to assist!

scraped_reviews.content: This is very clunky and has a weird, awkward interface, it's not intuitive, and it seems most of the stations I've tried to listen to are more commercials than actual programming. And it's not just a couple ads. it's regular breaks with a dozen ads right after another. So I switch the station, then get bombarded by I Heart Radio ADS. And then more station ads. so they should just call this advertisement with a little bit of actual radio now & then. I hate ads and IHR is ridiculous... ðŸ‘Ž
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Thomas, we're sorry to hear about your less than ideal listening experience. Would you be able to reach out to and provide us with additional info on your experience? Send an email to android@iheartradio.com (mailto:android@iheartradio.com). We want to keep you as a listener!

scraped_reviews.content: New 2025 issue: nearly every morning while listening to my local radio station, the app gets stuck in a loop playing ads. I don't notice until I realize the news didn't play on the half hour. I exit & restart and turns out they've been back in the air for who knows how long! frustrating Contantly downloads podcasts when it's set not to. Does this weird thing of changing stations, podcast episodes, and even to a totally different podcast randomly- I'm not even touching the phone.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Caitlin, we're sorry to hear about your less than ideal listening experience. Would you be able to reach out to and provide us with additional info on your experience? Send an email to android@iheartradio.com (mailto:android@iheartradio.com). We want to keep you as a listener!

scraped_reviews.content: I want to like this app, but the fact that it inserts songs into your Playlist CONSTANTLY is incredibly annoying because their suggestion algorithm sucks. a Playlist full of bad bunny, jessie reyes, and Rosalia should NOT be serving me Taylor Swift and Britney Spears. and its not just the occasional insert, it's every. other. song. so I hear a single song I chose, then 2-4 songs that are nothing like the Playlist at all, and despite giving them a thumbs down, they keep coming back.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, we'd appreciate some more info so we can help! Can you contact us by sending an email over to android@iheartradio.com? Look forward to hearing from you.

scraped_reviews.content: please fix the auto play feature. I have it toggled off to not autoplay when my phone connects to my car. and yet it still Auto plays *edit* I have to downgrade to 1 star. this app is nothing but radio with extra steps. even with the paid version, all you get is the same songs over and over and over again. then sprinkle in their annoying little clips about whatever that also repeat over and over again. as someone who spends a lot of time in the car, this is just unacceptable.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, We're sorry to hear about your less than ideal listening experience. Would you be able to reach out to and provide us with additional info on your experience? Send an email to android@iheartradio.com

scraped_reviews.content: I've had this application for about 4 years and it's been good. I do wish I could download my music to listen or do whatever I want to with it without having to use the application. If I had any requests, it would be to give specials often or go down on price every so often. I've been looking at 2 other apps that my kids use for free and says they can download music for anything to listen to without the whole app pulling up.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Jennifer, Happy to hear you're enjoying iHeartRadio! We will certainly forward your feedback to our product team!

scraped_reviews.content: I adore this app for listening to my favorite podcasts for free!!! Super easy to use, and it's always reliable....no glitches or crashes. Also I like that it's super easy to explore and has an amazing amount of podcasts, artists to choose from. I have discovered some of my favorite new artists & podcasts on this app. Seriously I can't believe that it's free.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Katja, thanks for taking the time to leave us feedback about your experience using iHeartRadio! We love hearing from our listeners about how we're doing!

scraped_reviews.content: good for what it does. BUT, though I understand the need for commercials, I would be so much better if you would CONTROL THE VOLUME OF COMMERCIALS!!! this is most likely the main reason I don't use this app very often. it is so annoying to be listening to something at one volume then have the commercial come on and almost double the volume.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi John, we're sorry to hear about your less than ideal listening experience. For further review of your concern, please send and email to   android@iheartradio.com. We'll be happy to assist!

scraped_reviews.content: App won't allow me to play what I want even though I pay for all access. Every time I search for something and tap it, it says "Building your station" but never does anything at all. I can't choose songs I search or even artist stations. It's been like this for a long while but everything I try doesn't fix anything. If this doesn't get fixed I'll be getting rid of my subscription amd delete the app!!!!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We definitely would like to look into the experience you've had within the app. When you have time, send a message to android@iheartradio.com so we can help.

scraped_reviews.content: I honestly hate this app so much. maybe I'm just missing something, but trying to create a playlist is incredibly unintuitive. the default playlist tab is a bunch of radio suggestions, which is whatever, but I want to access the podcasts I just added and mess around with the order I put them in. and why is it so difficult to find the list of the podcasts I'm following? I still haven't found the play list either! I get you want us to pay to upgrade, but why would I want to pay for this??
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, We're here to help! Shoot an email over to android@iheartradio.com so we can take a look at what's going on behind the scenes.

scraped_reviews.content: Lately the "free" version has entirely too many adds, more than listening to the actual radio, the ratio is 1 song to 1 add at this point, typically you get to hear two songs followed by two unstoppable adds, just not worth the aggravation, YouTube has fewer adds at.this point & they are skippable. Ah well, had a good run, back to local storage & digital music with at least some semblance of fidelity.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We definitely would like to look into the experience you've had within the app. When you have time, send a message to android@iheartradio.com so we can help.

scraped_reviews.content: Uninstalled. I wanted to use it, as opposed to web browser access. Ever since trying the app out for about a month, every morning listening to WOOD FM 106.9, I'd close the app whe ln done. Every time, I figured out that the app continued/continues to run in the background, draining my battery faster than prior to installing. I'd have to force stop. There is no place I've found in the app to shut that off completely. It "wakes up" on its own. Not dealing with it anymore.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're here to help! Shoot an email over to android@iheartradio.com so we can take a look at what's going on behind the scenes.

scraped_reviews.content: I am unsure how to send in a bug report other than making a review so here it is: I personally love this app and I use it for podcasts, but every time I close and open up the app again, all of the podcasts I follow dont show up in my podcast library untill I search them and find them again. This is very annoying. Also I think it would be a great idea to have all the "library" tabs to be at the top of the app so I dont have to scroll down on the homepage to find them.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We definitely want to look into this for you and make sure the issue you have is corrected. Shoot an email over to android@iheartradio.com so we can take a look at what's going on behind the scenes. Look forward to hearing from you!

scraped_reviews.content: I'm only giving 4 stars because no matter how many times I click "thumbs down" on a song, it keeps playing... it's the most annoying thing ever! I made my own playlist and although I appreciate other songs playing (that I may or may not add to my playlist) I'm sick and tired of this app not working well when I don't want or like a song. I wish there was a "delete" or "block artist" options. besides that, it's great!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Erica, Thanks for the review! We're sorry to hear about your less than ideal listening experience. Would you be able to reach out to and provide us with additional info on your experience? Send an email to android@iheartradio.com. We want to keep you as a listener!

scraped_reviews.content: I loved how when I listen to my downloads when one podcast would finish it would seamlessly start the next one. I could listen all day and not have to do anything as long as the podcasts were in order of listening preference. Since the last update, after each podcast it stops and I have to find my phone and see which is the next podcast as hit play. I wish to continuous listening would be restored. Especially for long drives, not safe to search the phone while driving.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Alice, We'd appreciate some more info so we can help! Can you contact us by sending an email over to android@iheartradio.com? Look forward to hearing from you.

scraped_reviews.content: Used to be great. Not so much anymore. I turn off permissions for Background Data Usage for most apps. It greatly improves phone performance. IHeart works fine without allowing background data usage EXCEPT for their annoying alerts telling you to turn it back on. It plays fine for a few minutes but once the alert comes through it stops and you have to reset. What is IHeart afraid of missing out on? Just turn off your stupid alerts and it'll work fine. Until then, I'll listen elsewhere. Goodbye.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Eric, We are sorry for the trouble you are having. We'd appreciate some more info so we can help! Can you contact us by sending an email over to android@iheartradio.com?

scraped_reviews.content: doesn't work with new android update. every time you open anything else on your phone it closes down and you have to start over. I'd recommend just buying a regular am/fm radio before I'd recommend downloading this app. update:: so I contacted the department for android like they requested, and their solution was for me, which was about 20 steps, including uninstalling the app. so I just uninstalled it and downloaded something more user-friendly. I don't work for this company.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're here to help! Shoot an email over to android@iheartradio.com so we can take a look at what's going on behind the scenes.

scraped_reviews.content: Does the dev do anything except request an email? That seems like the easiest way to avoid addressing users experiences... I came back to use my favorite music app, but there are ads for a basketball game that the audio is boosted EXTREMELY high, it is painful when listening with earbuds. I was really hoping the ad audio was corrected. 1 star and I will no longer use
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear about your less than ideal listening experience. Would you be able to reach out to and provide us with additional info on your experience? Send an email to android@iheartradio.com. We want to keep you as a listener!

scraped_reviews.content: I might uninstall it. There are some things I HATE! 1: it automatically adds songs to your playlist. I added Blurryface (twenty one pilots album I suggest trying) and I got some song I hated that wasn't even by twenty one pilots, couldn't delete it, and I couldn't even skip it, which leads into 2: you have limited skips! What in tarnation! It's this thing called greedy developers. Convincing people to buy premium by taking away required features. I am not emailing you, just fix this.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello Oliver,

We're sorry to learn about your listening experience. Can you please provide us with an email of your experience to android@iheartradio.com so we can investigate this for you. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: I used to love iHeart but since the update in June I get: Oops, looks like something went wrong. While I'm listening to a podcast it will stop. When I tap pause then play that pops up. Or after work I try to play my podcast, that pops up. My wi-fi is fine works with other devices & other apps on this Galaxy S24 Ultra. I have to turn my phone off and wait then turn it back on. Restarting does not work. I have forced stop & cleared the cache several times. Uninstalled & reinstalled the app too.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Kaylene, We're sorry to hear about your less than ideal listening experience. Would you be able to reach out to and provide us with additional info on your experience? Send an email to android@iheartradio.com.

scraped_reviews.content: edited review: within 24 hours, iheartradio's customer service team reached out to me to troubleshoot the issue. I went to open the app to take a video recording of the favorites refusing to load, and they are now spontaneously working. I can't in good conscience give it 4 or 5 stars due to the inconsistency, but i can at least bump it to a three because it's working now because it's working now
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We definitely want to look into this for you and make sure the issue you have is corrected. Shoot an email over to android@iheartradio.com so we can take a look at what's going on behind the scenes. Look forward to hearing from you!

scraped_reviews.content: the app is good but my only problem is that you can't chose which songs you want to listen to; why do you have to pay just to PICK a song you want to hear?? you can't even watch an ad for it, you have to PAY not to mention I had made a playlist and when I went to play it, it started playing songs that were added by iheart AND I CAN'T CHANGE IT. I don't like more than half the songs added by them, if you're going to add something like that, at least have the ability to toggle it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for taking the time to provide this feedback. We'll be happy to pass it along to the appropriate parties.  If you have any additional feedback you'd like to provide please shoot an email over to android@iheartradio.com.

scraped_reviews.content: JUNK! Unless you're connected to wifi, it drops because of all of the trackers embedded. I listen in a work truck without a radio over data on my phone. It works better when I open it in duckduckgo, which blocks some of the cookies. but it still keeps crashing. I tried tuneinradio, but they own that, too. I went to the local radio website (KFYI, Phoenix)and downloaded their app. They own that, too. They all crash. I finally bought a radio to listen to. I like radio, I do not heart this POS app
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Brad, we'd appreciate some more info so we can help! Can you contact us by sending an email over to android@iheartradio.com? Look forward to hearing from you.

scraped_reviews.content: 1.) The pop up ads right before you hit the play button, forcing you into a random website are invasive. 2.) The radio station will stop playing several times an hour and forcing me to hit play again, which makes it impossible to listen to it hands-free. 3.) During commercial breaks, the app will decide to launch into a random podcast instead of going back to the station I was listening to. I have to hit stop and play again. 4.) 90% of video ads freeze forcing me to exit and re-open the app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Morgan, we're sorry to hear about your less than ideal listening experience. Would you be able to reach out to and provide us with additional info on your experience? Send an email to android@iheartradio.com. We want to keep you as a listener!

scraped_reviews.content: I cancelled my plus service because you do not get what you pay for! It only let's you save certain songs to your playlist! I feel like if I'm paying for a service I should be able to save ALL the songs I want when I hear them! Ot took me a few cycles to cancel because it is hard to figure out how to cancel! I figured it was only 4.99, not worth the hassle. I finally figured out how to do it now!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear you are canceling. We are always working to improve our catalog. Could you email android@iheartradio.com and let us know which songs were unavailable for you to save?

scraped_reviews.content: This app is excellent. The song recommendations are always spot on and there's a wide library of music! One issue though: I have two very large playlists that I would like to combine. However, whenever I choose to add one to the other, it tells me there is a duplicate song and cannot combine. I don't know which song is a duplicate, and it would take forever to find it. Please make the copy just overwrite the other song!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Weiss, thanks for taking the time to leave us feedback about your experience using iHeartRadio! We love hearing from our listeners about how we're doing! We're here to help! Can you contact us by sending an email over to android@iheartradio.com? Look forward to hearing from you.

scraped_reviews.content: Until about a month ago, everything worked flawlessly. However, recently, it keeps stopping/buffering. This is the same no matter if I am at home on my personal and secure wifi, while traveling, walking, hotel rooms, etc. This applies to music and podcast playing. Once it stops, it buffers for almost a minute before picking up about a minute prior to when it stopped. I've tried deleting the app and re-installing, but i get the same results. Very disappointing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, We definitely want to look into this for you and make sure the issue you have is corrected. Shoot an email over to android@iheartradio.com (mailto:android@iheartradio.com) so we can take a look at what's going on

scraped_reviews.content: Update 8/13/24: I noticed this app has started to decline in quality. Every time I choose a different radio station it loads an ad before playing the actual station but what makes it more frustrating is it's a video ad!!! If you are going to do that do audio only because video uses more data and it's very disappointing. Also the variety of music that is offered on the radio has been very vague. I remember back when then it offered more music and less ads now it's the opposite. Would not use.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, we'd appreciate some more info so we can help! Can you contact us by sending an email over to android@iheartradio.com? Look forward to hearing from you.

scraped_reviews.content: For the most part I really enjoy this app. My only complaint is that I listen at work and frequently have to pause the podcast. When I return, it suddenly completes it, meaning, if I still have part of the episode left to listen to, it sends it to the end and checkmarks as finished. It then won't let me start over to get back to where I was. I have a bunch of episodes that I have never heard to the end. I contacted them several weeks ago, and had no response.

Loved it until I kept getting a message after EVERY song in my playlist that said, "This stream stopped because you're listening on another device." What other device?" I asked when I emailed iheart radio. I only listen on my phone. I thought the issue was resolved, but it isn't. And it is very annoying to see this message after EVERY song. Maybe I should just shut down the APP and find something else. I pay $9.99 per month, and I do not like having to manually skip to the next song.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We definitely want to look into this for you and make sure the issue you have is corrected. Shoot an email over to android@iheartradio.com so we can take a look at what's going on behind the scenes. Look forward to hearing from you!

scraped_reviews.content: I absolutely love this app. I can type in the name of an artist I want to hear, and it creates a playlist based on that artist's musical style. I can also listen to podcasts, live radio stations, talk radio, sleep meditations, mental health, and comedy - just about anything really. And I can save playlists to hear my favorites depending on my mood. It's my go-to app when I am getting ready to go out or need to chill and fall asleep. It has fewer interruptive ads than other apps.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Dianne, thanks for taking the time to leave us feedback about your experience using iHeartRadio! We love hearing from our listeners about how we're doing!

scraped_reviews.content: I paid for the premium subscription to not have to deal with ads. That makes the radio ads stop. But recently the app is doing pop up ads. They pop up every time I open the app or change the station, several times per day. It is super annoying. I tried the "contact support", but just got stuck trying to to talk to a bot that ignores what I say and just keeps giving articles that don't help. Most of my stations are available via other sources, considering just dropping the app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, we definitely want to look into this for you and make sure the issue you have is corrected. Shoot an email over to help@iheartradio.com so we can take a look at what's going on behind the scenes. Look forward to hearing from you!

scraped_reviews.content: It used to be great. then an update came not too long ago which kept the music going after an external audio source was disconnected; ok, wake the phone and kill the app. A new update came and I was like 'Heck yea!' but it turned it to be 'What the heck!' Now the app opens but pulls nothing, just a white screen of death in addition to no longer stopping after disconnecting an external audio source. Coincidentally, there is another update. Likely another form of dementia.

Ads play for at least 10-15 consecutive minutes and every 5 minutes of radio playtime! It's exhausting! The ads used to coincide with the length of the radio show's ads, not any more! If I'm missing my radio show, I might as well stream from a local stations website. I guess they are hoping it will force people to pay for the app, but I'm DELETING.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Rahne, can you let us know what radio station this is occurring on? Does this happen with any other radio stations? Send an email to android@iheartradio.com.

scraped_reviews.content: I did the free trial and after a month, it stopped giving the services of the subscription, such as picking a specific song to listen to. I couldn't find a way to cancel thw subscription, so I assumed that it was canceled. Without those benefits of the app, I deleted it because I never use it.   Turns out its been charging me for months. How am I subscribed still if its not giving me the benefits of being subscribed?  Without the subscription, the app isn't that great. They need to also make it more clear how to unsubscribe.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Kelley, we definitely would like to look into what you're experiencing with the app. When you have time, send a message to android@iheartradio.com so we can help.

scraped_reviews.content: Listened for quite a while. Lately nothing works. No sound. Very few stations. Tried all the recommended stuff, still nothing. They sent me an email with step by step instructions and discovered that I missed just one thing. Followed the instructions to a tee and boom..... Working like a champ. I'd like to thank Scott from iHeartRadio for the help.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi John, we're sorry to hear about your less than ideal listening experience. Would you be able to reach out to and provide us with addtional info on your experience? Send an email to android@iheartradio.com. We want to keep you as a listener!

scraped_reviews.content: When I was paying for iHeart it never faltered. Well a couple of expensive things happened in our lives so iHeart was an easy thing to suspend for a time being. Now podcasts freeze up, they stop, they won't start at all. So apparently if you pay, you get great service. You don't pay, you get substandard service at best. Shameful!!!! I don't mind the ads, pain in the neck, but I understand something has to pay for it, if not me. But the lack of podcasts playing is ridiculous!

The ads have gotten worse over time, and the themed stations only play the same set of songs in a loop. I'm extremely disappointed in the Rush station. Given that they have 20 studio albums, I'd like to hear a better selection of their music and not a handful of radio hits and live songs. It might be different if the live stuff was the top tier like the drum solos, but-and I say this with full love to Rush-the selections chosen could have been better. There's room to improve, but still good.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Amatheiya, happy to hear you're enjoying iHeartRadio! We're glad we can be your go to free music app! Be sure to check out all of the great Live stations, Artist stations, Podcasts and Playlists we offer!

scraped_reviews.content: I've had this for years and mostly listen to podcasts. Recently, it forgets where I'm at in my podcast and starts from the beginning every time. I know it's free because of ads, but lately, the ads are overwhelming. And lastly, this has always been an issue, but it would be nice if it would automatically play the next episode instead of back episodes. Might be time for a new app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi,

Thank you for your patience as we worked on a fix. Happy to let you know that the latest version of the app, found in the Google Playstore (10.15.1), resolves the issue you were experiencing with podcasts not saving your place!

scraped_reviews.content: Great for listening to live radio, but horrible for podcasts. Want to pick up your favorite podcast exactly where you left off? Yeah, that's not going to happen. For some reason this app keeps trying to load up the latest episode and you have to work extremely hard to get back to previous episodes because it closes previous episodes almost immediately. Also, it sucks when I can't listen to the baseball game on an AM radio station "due to licensing restrictions."

if you like commercials and have whatever your streaming just stop, then start a few seconds later, then just stop for no reason, you will love this app. I'm guessing that much of it is to push you into buying a subscription. 12/2024 Update: the app has greatly improved. It no longer "just stops". The ads are annoying, but if you're listening to live broadcast, the ads are from the radio station. Not much you can do about that. IHeart has a great selection of podcasts.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Steve, we're sorry to hear about your less than ideal listening experience. Would you be able to reach out to and provide us with additional info on your experience? Send an email to android@iheartradio.com (mailto:android@iheartradio.com). We want to keep you as a listener!

scraped_reviews.content: I was paying for ad free,unlimited skips and the a ility to pick any song and listen to it. I had this subscription for years. Now I just have ad free and unlimited skips. Was never told the subscription was changing, just went to play a song and it told me I need to upgrade. I checked the upgrade and it's $9.99! I just canceled my subscription. Bad decision. I will looking for another music app. You'd think that a company this big made enough money and wouldn't need to screw over loyal customer
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Brandon, we apologize for the trouble you are having, please send us an email to android@iheartradio.com.

scraped_reviews.content: The app works and it works well...but if you are listening to a live station there is just an insulting amount of advertisements. The commercial breaks go on for so long it's just unbelievable. I would listen to Fox Sports Radio live all day if I didn't have to listen to six minutes of ads every fifteen minutes. I'll just listen to the podcast on my podcast app and skip the ads.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Matthew, happy to hear you're enjoying iHeartRadio! We're glad we can be your go to free music app! Be sure to check out all of the great Live stations, Artist stations, Podcasts and Playlists we offer!

scraped_reviews.content: Hate that I can't skip more songs... shouldn't have to PAY FOR THAT!!! And when you skip 6 songs on one playlist...you HAVE to go to a different genre or playlist... and the skips carry-over... instead of starting over as if you had just opened up the app... Really sucks to not have more skips from the get-go... when you are really jamming, or you are the DJ for the night... Totally kills the mood when you can't skip over a song that nobody likes and you have ran out of Skips and now you have to pay for it... Then you have to start a whole new playlist, and start all over again and it is a pain in the ass... when you want to hear a certain song and you pull it up, you do not get to hear that song initially... You have to go through so many other songs that you may or may not like to get to the one song that you wanted to hear in the first place... So now I go on YouTube to hear the songs that I want instead of staying on iHeartRadio... Really kind of sucks...

Offered a free trial but immediately charged me same day. Otherwise love the app. Business practices suck though. July 2020 update: App works great as long as you are paying for +Plus or higher. When using the free membership the app continually stops playing requiring you to hit play again (usually after ads) and the app just closes on its own throughout the day while actively playing music. Ugh.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Mary, sorry for less than ideal experience. I see you have an open ticket with us and we have replied in hopes to sort this out!

scraped_reviews.content: You can get together any playlist for any occasion that there is and when you are wanting something different just use the ones that they have for you. I have been a member of this app from the beginning. Nothing but the best for it's listeners. I am meaning that literally. Everything that they have to offer us as listeners surpasses any pay satellite radio. Plus if you dont mind a little bit of an ad then its FREE TO USE AND ENJOY. It doesn't get any better than that my brother!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Kenny, thanks for the incredible review. You donâ€™t know how much we appreciate it. Did you also know weâ€™ve curated thousands of playlists, perfect for any mood and activity. Open the iHeartRadio App and tap Playlists and listen for free.

title: Todoist: Planner & Calendar
description:
Trusted by over 47 million people, Todoist is a to do list and a planning center for individuals and teams. Instantly declutter your mind, build habits, and boost your productivity.

With a simple tap, add your daily tasks and set reminders, enjoy multiple views like calendar, list and board, filter activity by work and/or personal life, share notes, collaborate on projects, and achieve peace of mind. 

Why choose Todoist?
â€¢ As a habit tracker, you can add tasks like â€œPlan next weekâ€™s work every Friday afternoonâ€ or â€œDo homework every Wednesday at 6pmâ€ using Todoistâ€™s powerful language recognition and recurring dates.
â€¢ Use it as a checklist to reach that mental clarity youâ€™ve been longing for by capturing tasks at the speed of thought.
â€¢ View any project as a list, board or calendar planner to give you ultimate flexibility when planning both your work and time. 
â€¢ Link Todoist with your calendar, voice assistant, and 100+ other tools such as Outlook, Gmail, and Slack.
â€¢ Collaborate on projects of all sizes by assigning tasks to others. Have all your teamwork at hand by adding deadlines, notes, files.
â€¢ Get up and running in no time with templates ranging from a schedule planner to packing lists, meeting agendas and more.
â€¢ Work towards your goals with insights into your personalized productivity trends.

Todoist on Android
â€¢ All the power from Android: task list widget, productivity widget, Quick Add tile, and notifications.
â€¢ Todoist is beautifully designed, simple to get started and intuitive to use. 
â€¢ Stay synced across your phone, tablet, and Wear OS watch, as well as your desktop and other devices.
â€¢ Location-based reminders available on upgrade. Never forget an errand again. 
â€¢ And the best from Wear OS: Day Progress tile and multiple complications.

Questions? Feedback? Visit Visit todoist.com/help

Recommended by:
> The Verge: â€œSimple, straightforward, and super powerfulâ€
> Wirecutter: â€œItâ€™s simply a joy to useâ€
> PC Mag: â€œThe best to do list app on the marketâ€
> TechRadar: â€œNothing short of stellarâ€

Use Todoist to plan or track anything:
â€¢ Daily and weekly planner
â€¢ Project management
â€¢ Time management
â€¢ Business planning
â€¢ Grocery list
â€¢ ADHD planner
â€¢ And more

*About Pro plan billing*:
Todoist is free. But if you choose to upgrade to the Pro plan, payment will be charged to your Google Play account, and your account will be charged for renewal within 24 hours prior to the end of the current period. You can choose to be billed monthly or yearly. You can turn off auto-renew in your Google Play settings any time after purchase.

â€¢ Collaborate on projects of all sizes by assigning tasks to others. Have all your teamwork at hand by adding deadlines, notes, files.

â€¢ Work towards your goals with insights into your personalized productivity trends.

Todoist on Android
â€¢ All the power from Android: task list widget, productivity widget, Quick Add tile, and notifications.
â€¢ Todoist is beautifully designed, simple to get started and intuitive to use.
â€¢ Stay synced across your phone, tablet, and Wear OS watch, as well as your desktop and other devices.
â€¢ Location-based reminders available on upgrade. Never forget an errand again.
â€¢ And the best from Wear OS: Day Progress tile and multiple complications.

Questions? Feedback? Visit Visit todoist.com/help

Recommended by:
> The Verge: â€œSimple, straightforward, and super powerfulâ€
> Wirecutter: â€œItâ€™s simply a joy to useâ€
> PC Mag: â€œThe best to do list app on the marketâ€
> TechRadar: â€œNothing short of stellarâ€

Use Todoist to plan or track anything:
â€¢ Daily and weekly planner
â€¢ Project management
â€¢ Time management
â€¢ Business planning
â€¢ Grocery list
â€¢ ADHD planner
â€¢ And more

*About Pro plan billing*:
Todoist is free. But if you choose to upgrade to the Pro plan, payment will be charged to your Google Play account, and your account will be charged for renewal within 24 hours prior to the end of the current period. You can choose to be billed monthly or yearly. You can turn off auto-renew in your Google Play settings any time after purchase.
summary: Simple yet powerful to do list, habit tracker & reminders. Organize work & life.

scraped_reviews.content: Absolutely loved this app and have been a subscriber since May 2021 or 2022. However, after the notice of price increase from $48/yr to $60â€½ Cancelled my subscription, and I'll just have to find something else. The app is super great, but financially it was already expensive and to increase the price in these timesâ€½ Yeah no, I'm disappointed in the company.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We understand the recent price change may feel disappointing, especially if youâ€™ve been using Todoist for a long time. If you subscribed to the Pro plan before June 2022 and have maintained your subscription continuously, please read this article for more information: https://www.todoist.com/help/articles/pro-legacy-plan-njefgq1UE ðŸ™

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using this app for years, but suddently it is giving me emails warning that my account will be deleted because I don't use it which is a bit frustrating. Also they've changed how many projects you can have unless you pay $5 per month. Before this change I had 12, now I can only have 5. Very dissapointing. I do like that there are limited ads and that I can get notifications in my email, I just wish there was a flat fee instead of a monthly fee for extras.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We apologize for the frustrating account warnings and the free project limit. The current limit is 5 active projects, and exceeding it will make the oldest ones view-only. Regarding the warnings, please report this bug directly to our CX team so they can investigate: https://todoist.com/contact

scraped_reviews.content: Caution to anyone who signs up for a free trial of premium. I found it quite difficult to find how to cancel the trial before I got charged. then they force you to actually type feedback before you can cancel. Just don't want anyone to get tricked into paying for a subscription they don't want because a company makes it intentionally difficult to cancel.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate you sharing your experience with canceling the free trial and are sorry it felt difficult. Weâ€™re always working to make subscription management easier. For a refund, please contact our CX team: https://todoist.com/contact. Weâ€™d also value your feedback on the cancellation flow ðŸ™

scraped_reviews.content: This app has great features and usability and it's awesome that it's cross-platform. however, one of the major issues that I've run into is that on my Android pixel devices, it seems to crash. every time I attempt to open it it starts to load and then immediately force crashes on its own. please fix for Android and I would once again highly rate this app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry you're experiencing crashes on your Android device. We'd love to help resolve this issue! Could you please reach out to us via https://todoist.com/contact so we can investigate further?

scraped_reviews.content: downloaded. I spent 10 min on it. deleted. wanted an app I could speak into and set tasks, dates, and reminders. I currently have voice notes, which works awesome for the first 2. It doesn't do reminders, unfortunately, so I need to constantly go back in and check the list. I drive a lot, so hands-free is essential. We have the technology, let's use it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks for sharing your feedback! We're currently testing Ramble in beta. Ramble is a voice-to-tasks feature in Todoist that lets you quickly add tasks using your voice: https://www.todoist.com/help/articles/dictate-to-add-tasks-with-ramble-P1Raq7vVF
If you would like to test this feature, please let us know ðŸ¤—

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using this app for a long time now, and had an issue where the widget crashed and wouldn't manually add back to my screen when clicking add. Update: I contacted the Todoist team and they assisted me in resolving my issue very quickly. If anyone encounters this issue, try holding the widget to add it to the screen as it seems like an issue where clicking the add button won't add the widget. Thanks again for helping me get the widget back, this app is great.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for sharing your experience! We really appreciate it ðŸ¤—

scraped_reviews.content: this app has been great for keeping track of what I have to do each day. it conveniently syncs on all of my devices so it's always up to date no matter where I am and what device I'm using. it's easy and satisfying to mark something as "complete". it reminds you when you have overdue tasks, but gives you the option to quickly reschedule them to another time so you dont feel guilty. all in all, it's a great app that does exactly what it needs to do! highly recommended!

I really like this app and use it everyday. However, these new Pop Ups that come out of nowhere congratulating me on checking off tasks are incredibly annoying. I don't need a digital pat on the back. Maybe some people like that and that's great. Personally, I just want to keep checking off tasks or looking at what's next to do and these pop ups just get in the way of that and irritate me. Can you please make it so I can turn them off? I've searched the settings and I can't find it anywhere.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Sara! We are sorry to hear that the pop-up is annoying. Please, can submit this via https://todoist.com/contact â†’ Product feedback, so our product team can review this feature? We really appreciate your time and thoughts on improving our product!

scraped_reviews.content: Fantastic. I don't just use it every day, I rely on it every day. Perhaps the best thing I can point out in a short review: the power of knowing I have to do something at a future date, telling ToDoist to put it on the list for then, and letting go of the weight of 'what if I forget?'. Tasks can be set for 'every other Tuesday' or 'every! 30 days'- i.e. 30 days from the last completion - great for filter changes or the like. I can create tasks via email and Teams with ease. Again: fantastic.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello Jonathan. It's great to hear the peace of mind Todoist brings you. Thank you for sharing your detailed feedback and for being a Todoister ðŸ¤—
â€‹

scraped_reviews.content: What is the point of a "To Do" list without reminders? Nope, you don't get a notification reminder unless you pay for premium, you can't even try it to see if it will work better than Microsoft To-Do (which can't stay running for anything). Without notifications/alarms I can make a "To Do" list using a notebook & pen or the paper calendar I have on my fridge! The whole point of searching for a useful app is to use modern features, like reminders/alarms & custom days, dates, & times.

Clunky for my purposes. Seemed like a good reminder app, I needed a list app. I wanted something I could use to save a grocery list, not something that tells me "Hey it's Tuesday time to go to the grocery." There's not a way to do that here without navigating too many menus. I'm coming from Wunderlist, so I am used to having direct and clean access to a group of to-do lists. Todoist hides your lists in favor of showing you upcoming tasks and reminders. I already have a calendar for that.

I am a fan of GTD which is really just a system of lists. I have tried all the big name task managers out there. Todoist is by far my favorite. Once you catch on to the natural language processing it is so easy to record everything that comes to mind in the "In" box then do a review later to decide what to do. Since I always have my phone I use the notification bar icon to record stuff as I think of it. Nothing ever gets lost or forgotten. It is wondeful to have a septem you can depend on!

Seems like a good tool, but almost nothing that I actually need to do with it is possible without a subscription. I'd happily puchase the app, or do a free trial period, but honestly, it annoys me when companies offer a free download only to put everything useful behind a paywall, especially when they try to give a discount for a year's sub before you even really get to try the features. Nope.

My favorite to-do app out of the insane plethora of to-do apps. I tried a lot but this one stuck with me the most. The key for me was how simple it is but powerful at the same time. A quick "Water plants every other Saturday p3 #House" correctly identifies the list it belongs to, sets up the frequency and marks its priority. This app seriously puts me in control of my day so nothing "slips" my mind any more. I have recommended it to my boss and he also loves it.

Over time I've tried a lot of to-do list apps. Todoist has long been one I've come back to over and over and finally, I've settled on it as my favorite. During the past few years Todoist has helped me stay focused to grow my freelance business. It's also helped me when I get anxious and overwhelmed. I can easily set my daily list to just a few manageable tasks and move things to the back burner or "inbox". I love Todoist and its Getting Things Done methodology.

I love the app. I just wish there was an option for a one time payment for premium. I have too many subscriptions, and I always cancel new subscriptions in a short amount of time because I find that I don't use the app enough to pay monthly or yearly. The apps that I can pay once for premium are the apps I usually stick with. I use this a lot for tracking my spending and budget, so a subscription is kind of counter intuitive.

You won't be able to label, comment (add more details), or get reminders on the free version, but that makes the free version pretty fair. You'll be able to sort things by project and date and prioritize things, and that makes it easy to see what you're going to do from day to day. This is all in a smooth, ad free experience. Plus you get a nice notification every morning telling you what tasks are due that day.

Great app. I pay for the subscription because I find the app invaluable for creating structure in my life. However, there was a recent update that changed how reminders are set, and while I do like the new feature, I wish they didn't remove the old one that allowed you to type a specific reminder with your keyboard. For example, I used to be able to type in something like, "every other Sunday at 8am", but now I can only select a specific date and time unless I use Todoist on my PC.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello! Thanks for your review ðŸ¤— If youâ€™d like to add a recurring reminder, you can try our new feature - reminder shortcuts. For example, type"!ev tue 8pm" for recurring reminders.
You can find all supported formats in this article: https://todoist.com/help/articles/introduction-to-reminders#use-shortcuts-to-create-reminders

scraped_reviews.content: Fantastic tool. Keeps all my tasks beautifully organized. Bug free. Wish that it was easier to manage recurrance. Seems you can only manage recurrance using the text feature in the name, but if you want to change the date or time of an occurrence you lose the recurrance settings. I wish there were an option for manually setting up the recurrence settings.

Since my first rating I have used Todoist for years. It is easy and powerful. It can be used in combination with Outlook, the email I must use at work. You can jot down quick reminders or organize complex projects or even keep detailed organized notes. You can set up filters to help you focus your work, which is very helpful. I love it and can't imagine using anything else.

This little app got me through my finals this quarter. The simplicity and variety of scheduling options makes it very useful. At first I thought premium was dumb and I wouldn't need it, but they offered a free 30 day trial without having to add my credit card and I quickly got addicted. Once the 30 day trial was over I couldn't go back so I paid the 36$ year which I would say is extremely reasonably priced. Very recommended, especially for school. Helped me stay on track and never miss any hmwk

Very good to do list app! Looks nice, easy to create new tasks with the automatic detection of dates, times, priorities, and topic. Does not show ads and is pretty generous with the free version. My only issue so far has been occasional desync between devices (can be solved by logging out and logging back in). Also, note that the free version doesn't allow you to set reminders.

Awesome but not perfect. Best I've found so far, and I've tried a ton. With a lot of my workflow being email/outlook based, the plug-in is incredibly helpful. It's a little complex, but with great power comes a bit of learning curve. I have an Android phone, an iPad, and work in Windows so the cross platform nature is key for me. Missing a couple things I think are key like being able to enter a completed date in the past (yesterday at least). I'm getting far more done using the app.

Powerful and simple. The only thing missing is integration with Google calendar, which I used for years, and I do not see any option to migrate either. So, no backward search for the events, calendar sharing and other integrations. Well, task and project-wise, this is a powerhouse! Much more simple and well designed than Google Keep I've been using for years.

The ability to prioritize and assign dates has been awesome in two major ways. First, the underlying stress of not knowing if I'm missing something is way down. I've kept other to-do lists, but they get so bloated and it's easy to lose track of what is really important, and then the very process of going through to check became a job in itself. The second way this app has changed my life is professionally. I answer emails quickly and finish easy things I need to do for teammates first.

I rely on this app daily for all my personal to do lists. But recent changes to functionality have made it less friendly to use than when I first got it.  For example it's much harder to add a time. Whenever I add a time to a task, it assumes I want to do it today, and I have to go back in and change it back to the original day.   Another annoyance is I can never use the word "march" in a task (like the March for Science) because the app thinks I mean the month. There are other words that happens with too, I can't recall them all right now.  Also like another use I don't like the circles on the left to check off the tasks, I keep deleting them accidentally.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Denise, sorry to hear that. Could you please let us know which changes exactly are you referring to, so we could improve them based on your feedback?

scraped_reviews.content: I use this app everyday at work--it's a great app with lots of options for keeping tasks organized. However, the latest update seems to have introduced a bug. Sometimes, while adding sub-tasks to a task, the app will auto-complete everything. All sub-tasks will simultaneously mark themselves as completed, and the only way to undo it is to go back and uncheck them one by one. Sometimes the cursor will also skip to the "Comments" box while in the middle of writing a sub-task.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Elise! We are sorry to hear that you experiencing this bug. Please, can you try to uninstall and reinstall the app? If it doesn't help, please reach out to our support team so they can help you out directly https://todoist.com/contact

scraped_reviews.content: Best to do list I've found. I used to use Trello but it didn't work for me. This does everything Trello didn't. Love the Inbox and how i can access it from a widget on my phone with one press. Also i have the other widget that shows my list of choice. I love how you can schedule items just by typing when you want them, even if it repeats. It's a very smooth interface. A few of the premium features would be really nice to have. It's tempting but i don't like recurring fees. I'd rather pay once.

Seems like a pretty cool app, I like how quick it is to set up tasks. Would be great for some people's situations, but since I'm looking for something for personal use and have no need for additional projects, larger files (or files in general), or filters it is a waste of money to pay a monthly subscription just to be able to set up any reminders at all. Guess I'm back to my search for a good todo list app...

I recently moved from a job where I utilized Microsoft Outlook's tasks. I struggled to find an app that could perform as well as Outlook. This app does everything and more! On PC...I love the predictive typing, Google Chrome attachment, flagging emails, typing notes, attaching files, reminders, and more. And it syncs across all my devices. On the app I love how fluid it is. It is so easy to use! After trying literally almost every to do app out there, this one gets my five stars! I have tried Google Tasks, Microsoft tasks, Wunderlist, Any.do, and many more. I've even paid for a majority of them. This one is well worth the money!

I love this app! I've tried a few other task list type applications, but this one really takes the cake! Their format is very flexible and has all the basics offered for free...except reminders. Data syncs well across devices, you can create subprojects, stacked task lists, and many other useful features! I check Todoist throughout my day and it's working well for me so far. If you need reminders, check out their premium version! It has plenty of features that are actually worth paying for. ;)

A few days in and so far so good. Definitely has a few non-intuitive functions. Setting custom reminders is weird...a pop-up should just appear to select a date and time, but instead you type it in then it tries to interpret what you type, then you select it if it is right. Very convoluted. Finally found the task completion statistics. Its next to your profile icon/picture when clicking on the three horizontal lines top left. Small circle with squiggly arrow with some numbers next to it.

The app is missing some very simple features. For example, once I sort by priority, I cannot sort anymore. I can't drag one P1 priority over another. The app is missing the ability to add new tasks to the top of your list. For example, if my list contains 30 tasks and a new task comes in that I need to do next, it gets thrown to the bottom of the list. The cost is also a bit weird considering it's lacking features that cheaper apps include.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us. We'd appreciate it if you could submit it through https://todoist.com/contact under the "Product Feedback" category. This will ensure that our product team can properly process your suggestions. We truly value your time and insights in helping us improve our product!

scraped_reviews.content: Incredibly convenient and simple, but I hope that the feature to attach photos (from your gallery or straight from your camera), links, and documents can be without the premium. Just a really naive wish, coming from a student. Other than that,  this app is really good, and its customer service is as admirable. Good job!

Functions fine in general, easy drag to subtasks. Can't adjust the Notifications to not go through "Do not disturb" mode (bad if you work off shifts), can't set timing of notifications. In a productivity app, scheduling is important. Reminders require premium, seriously? I'll just install one of the tons of free apps that include it for free rather than pay $3 month. Overall: Average functioning app that requires paid premium for some basic functions.

This app has everything I was looking for, but a bit confusing. At 9 tasks on the free version, it wouldn't let me add anymore. There was no indication why, it just wouldn't add anything. It's not enough tasks to use this as a daily planner. Plus, there wasn't anything that said about a limit or if buying pro would boost that limit. I'm too poor to take that chance. Bummer
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Cassidy, the task limit for each project is 300. From what you've described, it sounds like a bug. Could you please send us a message through https://todoist.com/contact so that we can take a closer look and find a solution? Sorry for the inconvenience ðŸ™

scraped_reviews.content: Just tried to use it. It showed some buttons during set up, including how to use Todoist. Turned it on, clicked on the sentence, finally continued on. I searched around, but never found help using the app. This might be a great app for people that know how to use it or are seasoned enough in apps to figure it out, but wherever the guidance is for those that don't know, it's buried too deeply to be any help. I was unable to do anything useful and, instead, a big waste of a chunk of my morning!
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Davis! Sorry to hear that you're having trouble getting started with Todoist. Here are some steps to help you get started: https://todoist.com/help/articles/get-started-with-todoist-OgNNJR
If you have any questions, please feel free to get in touch with us via https://todoist.com/contact. ðŸ¤—

scraped_reviews.content: Easy to use. It takes a second to get used to controls but then it super easy. I use the widget to add task throughout the day. My list stays condensed in my notifications. Only when I click on it, does it show me everything on my list. I love this app because it helps me remember things, and helps me stay on track when I have a million things going at once (I'm a Mom, Wife and Student).

Reliable, flexible, easy to use. I have more flexibility in organizing my to-do list the way I want to see it, and still use GTD. Only minor drawback: wish there was another way to set repeating tasks other than putting it into words. Putting it into words might seem easier than the menus seen om most other To Do apps, but you have to put the words in a precise way and even then it might still take a few tries before Todoist picks up the repeat request.

After trying *so* many different time management apps (even the $200/yr ones), this one the best. I love that the date you type in the add task bar automatically assigns it to the date. You can set events, tasks, and reminders all with voice to text while driving! The only thing I'd *love* is a more conventional "calendar" view where I can easily see what's in store for the month with one glance. Keep up the good work!

I downloaded this app because it's one that syncs with our smart speaker. However, I have recurring tasks, some of which are daily and that option does not work at all. It works are far as setting them up goes. Once I mark a task as done it skips the next due date. So my daily tasks are only showing up every other day. Not happy with that at all. I am in the process of finding another app ASAP!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, could you please tell us more about this specific recurring task at support@todoist.com?

scraped_reviews.content: Would be better if the Inbox was not treated as a project, but rather a scheduling location, and that items could be created in the inbox and EASILY (bulk) moved to other projects (but stay in the inbox) to then be scheduled to daily or next week or whatever Tracking would be easier. and the app would get a higher rating and I may actually subscribe.. Its a deal breaker for me.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thomas, sorry to hear that. Please note that all that can already be done with filters. You can even pin filters to the top area so instead of using the Inbox project, you could use the custom filter that will show you tasks for the next days or weeks in any projects. More info on filters: https://get.todoist.help/hc/en-us/articles/205248842

scraped_reviews.content: I love this app and I count on it to keep me organized but am not crazy about the latest update. I love that my list appears larger and easier to read but I don't like how it automatically deletes it when an item is hit. I've accidently lost items on my grocery list several times. It has left me feeling less secure that I've crossed everything off my list.

So far, it's great. Just a small suggestion though: In "comments section" of tasks, if there are multiple images posted, and I click one to view, I should then be able to view the next one by swiping left/right. Instead I have to click off the image I'm currently on and scroll down the list of comments to find the next one. This was not intuitive to me, because in most SMS apps, whenever you view an image someone has sent you, if you swipe to the left/right, it will scroll through all images.

This app is easy to learn and use, and yet so powerful. Update June 1st 2024: well I tried upgrading to the pro version today so that I could get reminders. Setting a reminder didn't work for me at all. First of all The quick selections for reminder time and date were shown to be relative to today. Yet the task I wanted to be reminded about is a year away! That just seems so silly. Of course reminders should default to be near the time of the task! Then no matter how hard I tried I couldn't save
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi David! We apologize for the inconvenience ðŸ™ This issue has been fixed in v11444.
If you have any other queries, please feel free to reach out via our contact form https://todoist.com/contact.

scraped_reviews.content: It's a great app, but just like any organization app, you have to meet it halfway with actual effort. If you don't actually intend to complete the work, don't kid yourself by getting the app. I only wish it included a calendar that displayed events in chronological order along with the list of events in bullet point format and that it sent reminders of events. I'm very picky about apps, but this one is actually nice.

I've tried multiple to-do list organizer applications and have found Todoist to be the best for me. Sync was a big problem cross platform for me even using Microsoft's To-Do. I'd create my lists ans tasks on my PC and then go to pull them up on my phone when on the job site onky to find nothing I had entered was there. This happened time and time again. so began my search and I found Todoist. It is fast, easy to organize. You can tag, prioritize, add photos. I really like the karma too!

The app looked very promising, but there were too many "Upgrade to premium" notifications when initially clicking through the app. From what I saw, I probably would have paid for a year if I was able to try out the fill app first. Instead, I got what felt like being kicked in the face by upgrade notifications. For these reasons, 3 stars and lost buisness.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Justin, sorry to hear that. After completing 5 tasks, the app gives you an option to start a free 30-day trial of the Premium version. We also offer a 30-day money-back guarantee if you'd like to evaluate it for another 30 days after the free trial.

scraped_reviews.content: App generally works, but it's impossible to include any time or date information in a task name, which is incredibly frustrating. For example, if you want a task that says 'tell family I need the car tomorrow', you're out of luck because 'tomorrow' is not allowed. You can't 'prepare for meeting at 12' either, or any such thing. Very annoying system.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ryan! You can turn off smart date recognition on a case-by-case basis by pressing delete or backspace on the desktop or by tapping on the highlighted word on mobile to unrecognize it. Here's more information: https://todoist.com/help/articles/enabledisable-smart-date-recognition

scraped_reviews.content: I tried the free version and was not impressed due to many features hiding behind the pay wall. Then I decided to try the paid version. Todoist pro does everything and more than any other program I have ever used. I strongly suggest trying the paid version. The customization can give you whatever you need in a Todo app! I can email to a task list even from mobile email. The ability to reference one task in another is a great way to link things together.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for such positive feedback, it really brightens up our day ðŸ™Œ

title: Microsoft Word: Edit Documents
description:
The document editor that you can take with you on the go â€“ Microsoft Word.

Write and create documents on your mobile device much like you do on your PC. Edit docs, share notes, convert to PDF documents, craft a powerful cover letter, and collaborate on projects using your mobile device.

Documents are easy to create, read, edit and share with Microsoft Word. Simplify on-the-go document collaboration and editing with our easy-to-use Word app features. Convert to PDF from Word and vice versa. From doc editing to collaboration and beyond, Microsoft Word is one of the best free writing apps for writing on the go.

Access files, documents and make edits with ease using the Word app. Read documents and open attachments with built-in docs viewer. Edit a PDF using Wordâ€™s PDF converter feature easily. Share files, documents and notes in the format youâ€™d like. Create documents on the go with Wordâ€™s expert editing tools anytime, anywhere.

Read, edit docs and create a document for any need. Resume templates, newsletters, brochures and more are accessible in the template gallery. Select the documents you would like and get started.

Blogger, writer, journalist, columnist or project manager: the Microsoft Word writing app moves with you.

Easy document editing, at your fingertips. Write a letter, create templates, read Word documents, edit docs and collaborate with your team anywhere! Get the docs and PDF app that can do it all.

Create Documents
â€¢ Use Microsoft Word as a cover letter creator by leveraging our beautiful templates
â€¢ Document editor keeps formats & layouts looking great.
â€¢ Docs app with templates for resumes, cover letters, forms & more.
â€¢ Documents are easily created for any writing task.
â€¢ Editing with rich formatting & layout.

Read, Write and Edit Documents
â€¢ Read docs, letters, PDFs & scripts on your device in Reading View.
â€¢ Document & PDF App: Edit documents from PDFs by converting to & from Word documents.
â€¢ PDF Converter: Save as PDF after editing & share the PDF easily.

Collaborate and Share With Anyone, Anywhere
â€¢ Document comments can be left right next to the text using for seamless collaboration.
â€¢ View documents using the built-in docs viewer.
â€¢ Edit documents as a team and stay on top of changes to the text, layout & formatting.
â€¢ Edit docs and view editor history: easily revert to view earlier drafts when you need to.

Microsoft Word for Anything
â€¢ Documents for your needs: Letters, blogs, scripts, notes, resumes, & more can be created beautifully designed modern templates.
â€¢ Write a letter easily using Wordâ€™s templates.
â€¢ Share documents as a link, email or attachment.
â€¢ Proofread, check spelling & review any document.

File Sharing Simplified
â€¢ Share files & collaborate with a few taps.
â€¢ File & document permission management: see who is working on what.
â€¢ Copy files into the body of an email message with its format intact or attach PDFs & docs to the email.

Document, PDf and writing app free of restrictions, hassle and workarounds. Download Microsoft Word  to edit documents anywhere, seamlessly.

REQUIREMENTS
1 GB RAM or above

To create or edit documents, sign in with a free Microsoft account on devices with a screen size smaller than 10.1 inches.

Write and create documents on your mobile device much like you do on your PC. Edit docs, share notes, convert to PDF documents, craft a powerful cover letter, and collaborate on projects using your mobile device.

Documents are easy to create, read, edit and share with Microsoft Word. Simplify on-the-go document collaboration and editing with our easy-to-use Word app features. Convert to PDF from Word and vice versa. From doc editing to collaboration and beyond, Microsoft Word is one of the best free writing apps for writing on the go.

Access files, documents and make edits with ease using the Word app. Read documents and open attachments with built-in docs viewer. Edit a PDF using Wordâ€™s PDF converter feature easily. Share files, documents and notes in the format youâ€™d like. Create documents on the go with Wordâ€™s expert editing tools anytime, anywhere.

Read, edit docs and create a document for any need. Resume templates, newsletters, brochures and more are accessible in the template gallery. Select the documents you would like and get started.

Blogger, writer, journalist, columnist or project manager: the Microsoft Word writing app moves with you.

Easy document editing, at your fingertips. Write a letter, create templates, read Word documents, edit docs and collaborate with your team anywhere! Get the docs and PDF app that can do it all.
